lead_paragraph: A hearing focused on an encounter between investigators and Angelika Graswald days after Vincent Viafore drowned in the Hudson River in 2015. She is accused of murdering him.

byline.contributor: Nate Schweber reported from Goshen, and Lisa W. Foderaro from New York.
byline.original: By NATE SCHWEBER and LISA W. FODERARO

headline.print_headline: Chat Led to Arrest in Death of Kayaker
headline.main: Fiancée Was ‘Happy-Go-Lucky’ Days After Kayaker Died, Police Say

snippet: A hearing focused on an encounter between investigators and Angelika Graswald days after Vincent Viafore drowned in the Hudson River in 2015. She is accused of murdering him.
abstract: Investigators say April 2015 encounter between Angelika Graswald and police officers on Bannerman Island in Hudson River, in which she admitted removing plug from fiancee Vincent Viaore's kayak while rowing to island days earlier, proved instrumental in murder charge against her; death had previously been treated as accidental.
